The systematic literature review consists of three main steps, i.e. reviewed study preparation, coding, and report writing. Each of these steps consists of several workflows.

## Reviewed study preparation
- Determining topics
- Database selections
- Determining keywords and searching databases
- Initial screening
    - inter-rater reliability
- Retrievel of full text
- Full text screening
    - Inter-rater reliability
